summary: I'm not saying she will, but Arya saying "I'm going to kill the Queen" instead of "I'm going to kill Cersei Lannister" is...
body: I’m not saying she will, but Arya saying “I’m going to kill the Queen” instead of “I’m going to kill Cersei Lannister” is interesting. The Stark’s just might take down both queens.

tags: i wasn't gonna write more than one paragraph
but i started to feel like i should to show my appreciation of her
and is more like us than most characters on the show
i don't know how this will go but i just love her so much and needed to put something out there just for her
i am prepared for hate but i don't care
i love sansa and no haters will change my mind
summary: Sansa's strength is so underrated.  None of us would have survived what she did even though it looks as if she has had it easy...
body:
Sansa’s strength is so underrated. None of us would have survived what she did even though it looks as if she has had it easy compared to other characters. She went through hell for years in King’s Landing and came out completely sane. She can still smile and love and though she does have some trust issues (which is understandable) she can still trust some too. It may not be much but it’s still something!

Trusting after being abused, manipulated and mistreated is a very difficult thing to do. It really is. But I feel that once she has had the time she needs to work through her trauma she will be able to completely trust again and realize that those around her now will never mistreat her as the people of her past have. Sansa is a lovely character that is just as complex as any of the others and has gone through her fair share of hardships.

And let’s be honest, just because the character doesn’t have much physical strength if any at all, doesn’t make them weak. Physical strength is not the only strength and is probably the least important of them all. You can’t be very strong physically if you’re in a bad place mentally because your mental and emotional health play a big part in your physical well being.

Sansa is strong. Not physically (that we know of) but mentally and emotionally. Those are important strengths to have and they are pretty hard to keep around when life has taken a turn for the worst. Yes she was manipulated and yes her heart was broken but despite all of that, she still opens herself up even if it’s just a little. That’s something only a very strong person could do.

summary: sansa stark: *watches her father be executed* *forced to look at the corpses of people she’s known her whole life* *endures...
body: sansa stark: *watches her father be executed* *forced to look at the corpses of people she’s known her whole life* *endures multiple public beatings* *still pretends to be a stupid girl in love with joffrey so that she can evade scrutiny* *brings a knife to the first secret encounter with dontos* *warns margaery that joffrey is a monster* *agrees to marry a tyrell to escape king’s landing* *finds alternate ways to escape if one fails her* *refuses to kneel to a lannister* *knew littlefinger’s plan without being told* *subjected to sexual abuse by multiple people* *somehow through all of this she remains an empathetic, intelligent individual learning how to rule as a kind and just liege lady/queen*

reblog.comment: sansa stark: *watches her father be executed* *forced to look at the corpses of people she’s known her whole life* *endures multiple public beatings* *still pretends to be a stupid girl in love with joffrey so that she can evade scrutiny* *brings a knife to the first secret encounter with dontos* *warns margaery that joffrey is a monster* *agrees to marry a tyrell to escape king’s landing* *finds alternate ways to escape if one fails her* *refuses to kneel to a lannister* *knew littlefinger’s plan without being told* *subjected to sexual abuse by multiple people* *somehow through all of this she remains an empathetic, intelligent individual learning how to rule as a kind and just liege lady/queen*

blog.description: We strive to make this a quality Sansan blog free of hate for book and show fans alike. Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. Header gif by @kingsleigh

summary: I wish the Hound were here. The night of the battle, Sandor Clegane had come to her chambers to take her from the city, but...
caption: I wish the Hound were here. The night of the battle, Sandor Clegane had come to her chambers to take her from the city, but Sansa had refused. Sometimes she lay awake at night, wondering if she’d been wise. She had his stained white cloak hidden in a cedar chest beneath her summer silks. She could not say why she’d kept it. The Hound had turned craven, she heard it said; at the height of the battle, he got so drunk the Imp had to take his men. But Sansa understood. She knew the secret of his burned face. It was only the fire he feared. That night, the wildfire had set the river itself ablaze, and filled the very air with green flame. Even in the castle, Sansa had been afraid. Outside … she could scarcely imagine it.

reblog.comment: I wish the Hound were here. The night of the battle, Sandor Clegane had come to her chambers to take her from the city, but Sansa had refused. Sometimes she lay awake at night, wondering if she’d been wise. She had his stained white cloak hidden in a cedar chest beneath her summer silks. She could not say why she’d kept it. The Hound had turned craven, she heard it said; at the height of the battle, he got so drunk the Imp had to take his men. But Sansa understood. She knew the secret of his burned face. It was only the fire he feared. That night, the wildfire had set the river itself ablaze, and filled the very air with green flame. Even in the castle, Sansa had been afraid. Outside … she could scarcely imagine it.

Sometimes she lay awake at night, wondering if she’d been wise. She had his stained white cloak hidden in a cedar chest beneath her summer silks. She could not say why she’d kept it. The Hound had turned craven, she heard it said; at the height of the battle, he got so drunk the Imp had to take his men. But Sansa understood. She knew the secret of his burned face. It was only the fire he feared. That night, the wildfire had set the river itself ablaze, and filled the very air with green flame. Even in the castle, Sansa had been afraid. Outside … she could scarcely imagine it.
trail.content: I wish the Hound were here. The night of the battle, Sandor Clegane had come to her chambers to take her from the city, but Sansa had refused. Sometimes she lay awake at night, wondering if she’d been wise. She had his stained white cloak hidden in a cedar chest beneath her summer silks. She could not say why she’d kept it. The Hound had turned craven, she heard it said; at the height of the battle, he got so drunk the Imp had to take his men. But Sansa understood. She knew the secret of his burned face. It was only the fire he feared. That night, the wildfire had set the river itself ablaze, and filled the very air with green flame. Even in the castle, Sansa had been afraid. Outside … she could scarcely imagine it.

blog.title: sansa stark & sandor clegane are soulmates

summary: “My skin has turned to porcelain, to ivory, to steel.”
body:
“My skin has turned to porcelain, to ivory, to steel.”

The reason Sansa’s skin has changed to steel is because she’s exchanging character traits with her warg soulmate/husband, Sandor Clegane, aka her knight in dented armor aka “steel skin,” who is also a thick-skinned son of a bitch who can take a tremendous amount of punishment.

tags: honestly the nerve of that wench and her stans
summary: I always get annoyed seeing people hating on Sansa in season 7, while blindly supporting Arya's actions against Sansa. Like,...
question: I always get annoyed seeing people hating on Sansa in season 7, while blindly supporting Arya's actions against Sansa. Like, does no one see how messed up it is for Arya to threaten Sansa with a knife, or to imply that she should kill the men who talk about Jon's leadership skills? Or hell, to assume Sansa is still that same, 12 year old girl she knew years ago? And to cover it by saying Arya was "testing" Sansa? As if Sansa needed testing at all?
answer: Lmao every time they try to push the idea that Arya was right using flimsy evidence, something comes and knocks them off their high horse from Sophie’s Sansa video to Maisie’s interview. Arya was acting like psycho bitch with uncontrollable bloodlust, more rabid dog than human. I mean we know Sansa’s side of the story so Arya’s claims had no merit. I loved that Sansa stood up to her (and antis) with actual facts and reminded miss Arya that while she was walking the same forest over and over again, Sansa was enduring a lot of hardship.
